tasks.title: MLXDash: Implement OllamaService for API Polling
tasks.description: Create the OllamaService class that polls Ollama's REST API to detect running models and gather performance metrics.
tasks.details:
Implement OllamaService.swift:
- Poll GET /api/ps every 1 second for running models
- Parse response for model name, size, VRAM usage
- Poll GET /api/tags for available models list
- Handle connection errors gracefully (Ollama not running)
- Use async/await with URLSession
- Publish updates via Combine or @Observable

Model data structure: ModelInfo with name, size, vramSize, digest, family, parameterSize.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests with mocked responses. Integration test with live Ollama showing model detection.

tasks.title: MLXDash: Build MenuBarView with Live Metrics Display

tasks.details:

- Dropdown sections:

  - Memory: VRAM used / total
  - Quick Actions: Benchmark, History, Preferences
- Update frequency: 500ms for tok/s, 2s for memory
- Support light/dark mode with proper SF Symbols
tasks.testStrategy: Visual verification in light/dark mode. Metrics update when model is generating.

tasks.title: MLXDash: Implement SystemMetricsService with IOKit
tasks.description: Create SystemMetricsService to gather GPU utilization, thermal state, and memory pressure using IOKit and system APIs.
tasks.details:
Implement SystemMetricsService.swift:
- GPU utilization via IOKit (Metal performance shaders activity)
- Thermal state via ProcessInfo.processInfo.thermalState
- Available memory via os_proc_available_memory()
- Unified memory usage for M-series (shared CPU/GPU)
- Update frequency: 2 seconds
- Graceful fallback if IOKit access fails

Note: Full GPU utilization may require private APIs or approximation.
tasks.testStrategy: Metrics returned are reasonable values. No crashes on M1/M2/M3/M4 Macs.

tasks.title: MLXDash: Implement BenchmarkService
tasks.description: Create the benchmark runner that executes standardized prompts against loaded models and measures performance metrics.
tasks.details:

- Standard benchmark: 10 prompts of varying complexity
- Prompts: short (10 tokens), medium (50 tokens), long (200 tokens)
- Metrics collected: tokens/sec, time to first token, total time
- Calculate: avg tok/s, p50 latency, p95 latency, peak memory
- Store results in SQLite via HistoryService
- Progress callback for UI updates
- Cancellation support
- POST to /api/generate with stream:true to measure token rate
tasks.testStrategy: Benchmark completes in <60 seconds. Results stored and retrievable.
